channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Madeleine McCann investigators resume digging at German allotment
item.description: Brueckner lived at the Hannover vegetable garden with a shed and cellar, failed to register with local authorities and talked about planning his return to southern Europe, his neighbour says.

item.title: McDonald's closes branch in West Midlands after five employees tested positive for coronavirus
item.description: The branch, in Sandwell near Birmingham, has been temporarily closed after several employees recently tested positive for coronavirus.

item.title: Conservatives tear into big tech CEOs claiming Facebook, Google and Twitter are CENSORING Trump
item.description: Republican lawmakers tore into big technology firms at the start of Wednesday's House Judiciary Hearing on antitrust laws, claiming the platforms all exhibit anti-conservative bias.

item.title: Oxford-educated career diplomat is 'C' - new head of MI6
item.description: Richard Moore, 57, will take over the MI6 chief role from Alex Younger in the autumn. Moore has frequently shared photographs of him and his wife Maggie on social media.

item.title: Rachel Riley and Tracy Ann Oberman drop lawsuit against barrister who re-tweeted blogger's article
item.description: Rachel Riley and Tracy-Ann Oberman have dropped a libel action against a self-confessed 'Buddhist barrister' who retweeted an article accusing them of harassing a 16-year-old

item.title: Sir Tim Laurence admits he was 'surprised' at finding the royal households were 'full of laughter'
item.description: The Princess Royal's husband of almost 30 years Sir Tim made the remarks in a new British ITV documentary about Anne ahead of her 70th birthday in August, which is set to air at 9pm.

item.title: Coronavirus: Europe had 50% 'excess deaths' at outbreak peak
item.description: The figures show that over the course of one week, between March 30 and April 6, European countries saw more than 33,742 excess deaths, according to data released earlier today.

item.title: Study finds rich people are more likely to get better sleep
item.description: Study from the CDC reveals the amount of money you have determines how much sleep you get each night. Those who make 400% above the poverty line are more likely to sleep longer.

item.title: Queen DID deny Meghan Markle chosen wedding tiara, book says
item.description: Meghan Markle has blamed the Queen's favourite dresser for a row over which tiara she could wear at her wedding to Prince Harry in 2018, a new book on the Sussexes claims.

item.title: Scientists prove the Lamb of God restoration is correct
item.description: The artwork is a founding masterpiece of Western European painting and was made by brothers Hubert and Jan Van Eyck.

item.title: Lowly flies get super names as scientists find inspiration in Marvel
item.description: Australian scientists have named five newly-discovered fly species after characters in the the Marvel comic universe.

item.title: Mysterious lights in night sky stun residents of Shenzhen, China
item.description: Social media footage shows the colourful lights glowing above the skyscrapers on Saturday evening in China's southern metropolitan city Shenzhen. The scene was identified as light pillars.

item.title: Nike is officially the hottest brand in the world after topping the quarterly Lyst Index
item.description: The sportswear giant climbed two places to beat the likes of Off-White, Gucci and Balenciaga, which were placed second, third and fourth respectively.

item.title: Ancient 'globular cluster' remnant found at edge of Milky Way
item.description: The ancient collection of stars was torn apart by our galaxy, the Milky Way, over two billion years ago when Earth's most-complex lifeforms were single-celled organisms.

item.title: Grants Shapps defends quarantine change that ruined holiday
item.description: The minister was in Spain when his own department decided to reimpose quarantine on arrivals from the popular tourist destination to 14-days' self-isolation after a surge in coronavirus cases.

item.title: Man opens fire on pair for not social distancing in Miami hotel
item.description: Veronica Pena and her son, both visiting Miami Beach from New Mexico, said they were in the lobby of the hotel when they first saw Douglas Marks, who fired 'several' shots.

item.title: Holocaust survivors urge Facebook to remove denial posts
item.description: Holocaust survivors are posting a video a day on Facebook under the hashtag #nodenyingit to pressure CEO Mark Zuckerberg to removing Holocaust-denying groups, pages and posts.

item.title: Firm supplying Tesco and Waitrose sacks staff for animal cruelty
item.description: Shocking video footage emerged showing staff at Far Marsh Farm in East Yorkshire hitting and punching goats. St Helen's Farm dairy company, who the farm are suppliers for, launched an investigation.

item.title: Naomi Osaka 'creeped out' by critics of Instagram bikini shots
item.description: The 2018 US Open champion took to Twitter to slam people who have been 'commenting' on bikini shots that she has shared while in lockdown at home.

item.title: Arizona freight train derails causing fire and bridge collapse
item.description: Pictures from the scene Wednesday morning show part of the bridge over Tempe Beach Park has also collapsed.

item.title: Suspected explosive device out of river in Leeds city centre
item.description: The rusty, 'shell like' object was pulled from the River Aire in Leeds, West Yorkshire at around 2pm today, prompting the evacuation of an area near Granary Wharf.

item.title: Coronavirus: Women on the Pill may be at risk of blood clots
item.description: Both coronavirus and high levels of estrogen from the pill, being pregnant or taking HRT raise cot risks, warn doctors at Maine Medical Center and say aspirin or staying off the pill may lower risks.

item.title: Hatton Garden thief asked to pay back £5.9m from robbery
item.description: Michael Seed, 59, was jailed for 10 years in March 2019 after becoming the 10th person to be convicted in connection with the 2015 Easter Bank Holiday weekend heist in London.

item.title: NASA's Perseverance rover to Mars will search for alien life
item.description: On July 30, NASA is set to kickoff its highly anticipated Mars 2020 mission that sends the Perseverance rover to the Red Planet in search of life. The launch starts at 7:50am ET.

item.title: 'Suicidal' man survives eight-storey fall after landing on minivan
item.description: Police said the 21-year-old was conscious and had no visible injuries following the suspected suicidal attempt. Eyewitnesses said he got up by himself and sat on the road for 10 minutes.

item.title: Meghan Markle and Prince Harry's charity withdraws application
item.description: Harry and Meghan submitted papers to change the Sussex Royal Foundation name - but then withdrew them after nine minutes. An earlier document revealing the change is still published.

item.title: Georgia inmates save life of prison guard having heart attack
item.description: Mitchell Smalls, Terry Loveless and Walter Whitehead all rushed to Deputy Warren Hobbs' aid when he fell unconscious at his desk in Gwinnett County Jail.

item.title: Iran launches underground ballistic missiles for first time
item.description: Iran's Revolutionary Guards claims to have launched ballistic missiles from 'the depths of the Earth' today during the last day of military exercises near sensitive Gulf waters.

item.title: Dr Stella Immanuel says Jesus will destroy Facebook for removing her video
item.description: Dr Immanuel warned Facebook that it is 'not bigger than God' and that Jesus will crash its servers after it deleted a video of her claiming hydroxy is a coronavirus cure for spreading misinformation.

item.title: Donald Trump orders 12,000 troops out of 'delinquent' Germany
item.description: The U.S. will bring about 6,400 forces home and shift about 5,600 to other countries in Europe. Trump said 'we're reducing the force because they're not paying their bills. They're delinquent.'

item.title: Piers Morgan on 'destructive duo' Johnny Depp and Amber Heard
item.description: I think we've all consumed enough lurid, gruesome details from Johnny Depp's libel case over the past 16 days to reach our own verdicts on the movie star and his ex-wife, actress Amber Heard.

item.title: Trump: I DIDN'T talk to Vladimir Putin about paying the Taliban to kill American troops
item.description: Donald Trump said he did not bring up Moscow putting a bounty on American troops during his recent phone call with Russian President Vladimir Putin, dismissing the reports as 'fake news.'

item.title: Teenager avoids jail after making autistic black boy kiss shoe
item.description: The 17-year-old boy and girl were arrested after the shocking incident at Holmfirth Cricket Club in West Yorkshire.

item.title: Donald Trump says he is looking into BANNING TikTok
item.description: President Trump said Wednesday that the U.S. is considering banning the social media app TikTok amid fears that it could be used by China to spy on Americans.

item.title: Coronavirus: 65 migrants rescued in Mediterranean test positive
item.description: Maltese authorities say the group of migrants rescued on Sunday tested positive for the coronavirus after being rescued by the country's coastguard.

item.title: Fearless frog stares down tiger taking a nap in water hole
item.description: Aditya Singh, 54, photographed the unlikely encounter in Ranthambhore National Park in Rajasthan, India, as the Indian skipper frog clambered on to the back of a Bengal tiger.

item.title: Altruist Dermatologist SPF50 Light Face Fluid £9 at Amazon
item.description: UVA and UVB rays remain the most significant cause of premature and accelerated skin ageing, and with a heatwave expected to sweep across the UK from Thursday, it's essential to ensure your...

item.title: Coronavirus: Trump 'owes us an apology', says Chinese expert
item.description: Shi Zhengli, who heads the team probing bat coronaviruses at the Wuhan Institute of Virology, blasted Trump's claim that he had 'seen evidence' the pandemic originated at her lab.

item.title: Fury as BBC social affairs correspondent uses n-word in report
item.description: Social affairs correspondent Fiona Lamdin (pictured) used the offensive language when covering a collision between a Honda Accord and a 21-year-old man in Bristol.

item.title: Labour-run Enfield first council in UK to veto meat at ALL events
item.description: Enfield Council plans to serve only vegan and vegetarian meals when it hosts events in a bid to tackle climate change. The north London council is understood to be the first in the UK

item.title: Kanye West hires top political advisers to get on more ballots
item.description: Kanye West is expanding his campaign team in a bid to get on the ballot in more states, after he recently filed paperwork for New Jersey, Missouri, Oklahoma and his home of Illinois.

item.title: Meghan Markle attempts to keep five friends' identities secret
item.description: The Duchess of Sussex has applied for an order to keep secret the identities of the women, all 'young mothers', at a hearing at the Royal Courts of Justice in London.

item.title: Toddler gets third-degree chemical burns from Primark nail glue
item.description: Full-time mum Laura Tucker, 32, from Reading, had applied false nails and fastened the top on the glue pot and put it on a shelf - where Santi Haines managed to reach it when her back was turned.

item.title: Murder suspect 'kept two victims' bodies in freezer for years'
item.description: The corpses of Henriett Szucs and Mihrican Mustafa were found together in a small chest freezer at accused murderer Zahid Younis' home in east London after a police search last year.

item.title: Dog nearly run over as man holds lead at moving car's window
item.description: The terrified dog was filmed running dangerously close to the moving grey car as its owner drove on the wrong side of a rural road near Lochgelly in Fife, Scotland.

item.title: UK's loveliest train journeys include real-life Hogwarts Express
item.description: Luxury rooms with en-suites, fine dining, spas, stunning countryside views. Not only can you find these at Britain's luxury hotels, but also on its railways...

item.title: UK is set for 91F burst of Spanish sun on Friday when warm front sweeps in from Iberia
item.description: Travellers forced to cancel trips will see back gardens, beaches (pictured, Dorset) and parks become hotter than the Balearic Islands.

item.title: Zimbabwe offers £2.7bn compensation to 4,500 white farmers
item.description: Zimbabwe on Wednesday signed a US$3.5 billion compensation agreement with white farmers whose land was seized over 20 years ago under the country's controversial reforms.

item.title: Britain's coronavirus cases rise 14% in a week as experts urge ministers not to panic
item.description: Department of Health chiefs reported an additional 763 cases, taking the total to 300,692. A further 83 coronavirus deaths were recorded in Britain - taking the total to 45,961.

item.title: Executive killed by a shark in Maine was giggling with her daughter before she screamed
item.description: Julie Dimperio Holowach, 63, was swimming in a wetsuit with her daughter near Bailey Island, Harpswell, on Monday when an eyewitness saw her 'dip under the water'.

item.title: Shoplifting seagull steals bag of crisps from Devon newsagent
item.description: The brazen bird, who is known by locals as Steven the seagull, was filmed entering Moores Newsagents in Exmouth, Devon, and stealing a packet of BBQ-flavour crisps.

item.title: Priti Patel: Social media firms have let football racism 'fester'
item.description: The Home Secretary was at Wembley this afternoon ahead of Saturday's FA Cup final between Arsenal and Chelsea to discuss abuse aimed at players and fans on the web.

item.title: We want a congestion charge for campervans, say locals
item.description: Many tourists are now going 'fly camping' if they cannot secure a hard-to-find spot at a campsite, with the National Trust reporting a large rise in the practice with litter and campfires left behind.

item.title: Calls for Exeter Chiefs rugby club to change 'offensive' name
item.description: Activists set up a petition calling for the 150-year-old rugby union side to change over its 'harmful' impact on Native Americans. Pictured: Its mascot.

item.title: China accused of hacking Vatican ahead of key diplomacy talks
item.description: The Vatican and the Catholic Diocese of Hong Kong have been the targets of 'Chinese state-backed hackers' called RedDelta ahead of talks on the renewal of a 2018 deal thawing relations.
item.media:description: FILE - A file photo of St. Peter's Square at the Vatican, taken on April 10, 2020. According to U.S.-based monitoring group Recorded Future, the Vatican and the Catholic Diocese of Hong Kong have been the targets of alleged Chinese state-backed hackers ahead of talks on renewal of a landmark 2018 deal that helped thaw diplomatic relations. (AP Photo/Alessandra Tarantino)

item.title: Twitter says sorry for being slow to react over Wiley's anti-Semitic posts
item.description: Grime rapper Wiley was condemned for a series of posts on the social media platform starting on Friday, and was initially given a temporary ban, with the majority of his tweets remaining visible.

item.title: Coronavirus Sweden: 'Very positive' downward trend reported
item.description: Sweden recorded only 1,716 new cases last week, down from 9,094 just a month earlier, and deaths have also been on the decline.

item.title: Mexican couple rescue 10 dogs from Hurricane Hanna in bucket
item.description: Santos Vaquera Herrera and Beatriz Escandón were able to save their 10 pet dogs after Hurricane Hanna flooded their home of 28 years in Reynosa, Mexico.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell unsealed documents are set to be released
item.description: Epstein victims fear sex tapes and photographs featuring them being abused could be described as part of the unsealed evidence and eventually shown in court during Maxwell's criminal trial.

item.title: Photos of Coney Island from 1970s decay to 1990s revival
item.description: Street photographer Harvey Stein started taking images of the Brooklyn neighborhood and its people in 1970. He is publishing his third book on the beach spot slated for early 2022.

item.title: Oldham overtakes lockdown-Leicester to have the highest second coronavirus infection rate in England
item.description: NHS data today showed Oldham recorded 54.3 coronavirus cases for every 100,000 people between July 20 and 26 - a rise of 191 per cent in seven days.

item.title: National Trust are latest victims of cyber hacker
item.description: Information about millions of people was copied by the unidentified criminal who gave assurances that it had all been 'destroyed' after a ransom was paid.

item.title: How Vladimir Putin became Russian president for life
item.description: Since at least 2006, former Kremlin adviser Sergei Pugachev told Reuters, Putin has been grappling with the question of succession.

item.title: Martin Lewis works to 'give back' after selling website for £86m
item.description: Speaking to the podcast Full Disclosure with James O'Brien, Manchester-born Martin Lewis, 48, revealed onthat he felt a lot of his success was down to luck, and that gave him a 'responsibility'.

item.title: Police hunt dwarf who was with woman moments before rapist carried her through city centre
item.description: The victim left a bar on Broad Street in Birmingham with a dwarf known only as Kevin on October 19, 2014 before she was raped nearby by another man.

item.title: Sir Richard Branson celebrates 70th birthday at surprise party
item.description: Sir Richard Branson celebrated his 70th birthday with a surprise party organised by his children Holly, 38, and Sam, 35. Holly shared photos of the soirree on Instagram.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Outbreak at pub packed with 200 drinkers
item.description: Revellers and staff who have been in the Crown and Anchor, in Stone, Staffordshire, are being told to get swabs done - and anyone who has been in close contact with them should now have a test.

item.title: £1 million Victorian mansion in Yorkshire raffled for £2 a ticket
item.description: Owner Dennis Goodridge admitted he decided to raffle the property in West Yorkshire on the competition app Raffall after some 'real soul searching' with his family.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Government urged not to 'panic' over new cases
item.description: Professor Paul Hunter, an infectious disease specialist at the University of East Anglia, told MailOnline: 'Give us a couple of weeks before we start panicking.'

item.title: Bakery turns away elderly customers who wanted to pay in cash
item.description: The manager at the Arnold branch of Birds Bakery in Nottinghamshire said the chain is only taking contactless and card payments 'due to the current spread of coronavirus'.

item.title: Coronavirus US: Death toll nears 150k as cases rise in Midwest
item.description: The number of American who have died from coronavirus approached the 150,000 mark on Wednesday.

item.title: Driver, 41, accused of killing 13-year-old girl must have blacked out of the wheel, court hears
item.description: Gardene De Carvalho, 41, was at the wheel of a Fiat 500 when she collided with Victoria Carson near the schoolgirl's home in Barnet, at 9.35pm on June 29.

item.title: Ohio woman SLAMMED for taking daughter, 2, HUNTING
item.description: Beka Garris, 31, from Ohio, has been hunting since she was 10 years old and she is now passing the hobby onto her daughter Isabella.

item.title: Fury as hundreds of Virgin Media users battle with internet outage for second day in a row
item.description: Hundreds of Virgin Media users across the UK were today left unable to connect to the internet when the network provider suffered another outage.

item.title: Sol Bamba burglar was victim of 'modern slavery', escapes jail
item.description: The then 17-year-old, who cannot be named, stole jewellery, designer handbags and a £62,000 Range Rover from Cardiff City footballer Sol Bamba's house in the heist with three friends.

item.title: Two teenagers are catapulted through the air as swing snaps at playground in Kazakhstan
item.description: CCTV captured the two teenage boys, aged 14 and 13, being flung to the ground after the swing in a playground in Pavlodar, Kazakhstan, snapped off its metal frame as they both stood it.

item.title: Royal Navy medic's undercover WWII heroics remembered
item.description: Dr Darrell Wilkinson was part of an undercover crew of a Greek fishing boat that facilitated SAS and Special Operation Executive (SOE) missions during the Dodecanese campaign.

item.title: Out-of-control motorbike bounces over supermarket car park
item.description: The out-of-control bike bounces several times across a line of empty parking bays before the motorcyclist is thrown off his vehicle at a Tesco car park in Batley, West Yorkshire, on Tuesday.

item.title: Paedophile 'used Amazon vouchers to buy child porn online'
item.description: Kevin Sheppard (pictured), 26, from Kettering, admitted three counts of making indecent images of children (IIOC) and one count of encouraging the distribution of IIOC in July 2018.

item.title: Doctors say women cyclists can be affected by genital injuries
item.description: Endurance cyclist Jasmijn Muller, from Belgium, told Radio 4's Woman's Hour yesterday how she has undergone two operations on her labia. Here FEMAIL reveals the problems caused by cycling.

item.title: Double amputee is swimming AND bodybuilding champion
item.description: Du Hai, 28, was shunned and seen as 'a little monster' by other children after he lost the limbs due to a tragic railway accident at the age of five. He won gold medals in swimming and bodybuilding.

item.title: UK sees surge in castle break-ins and illegal metal detecting
item.description: Two intruders were caught clambering on the rooftops of 12th-century Amberley Castle, West Sussex in the early hours of the morning and arrested for burglary and criminal damage.

item.title: Man shot dead by assassin in court facing blasphemy charges
item.description: A young Pakistani Muslim walked into a courtroom in the northwestern city of Peshawar on Wednesday and shot and killed a fellow Muslim who was on trial for blasphemy, a police officer said.

item.title: 'Made from fruit juice' claims make people think sweets healthy
item.description: Waitrose's Fruit Jellies, which proudly claim to be 'made with fruit juice', are loaded with a staggering 62g of the sweet stuff in half a packet (100g). It comes amid a UK crack-down on obesity.

item.title: Bath parents quit the rat-race to stay with their two young children in a FIELD with outdoor kitchen
item.description: Tom Jackson, 42, and wife Jen (pictured with their children), 41, quit their jobs as a corporate sales account manager and a teacher and sold their house in Bradford-on-Avon, Wiltshire.

item.title: China's Mars probe photographs Earth en route to Red Planet
item.description: The image, which shows the two celestial bodies as small crescents in the empty darkness of space, was taken 746,000 miles (1.2 million kilometres) away from Earth.
item.media:description: A view of the Earth and Moon taken by China's Tianwen-1 Mars probe from a distance of 1.2 million kilometers

item.title: Hands-off approach lowers stress and improves parenting
item.description: Researchers from Australia studied 15 parents who were enrolled in parenting classes and studied how effective a hands-off approach was.

item.title: Barclays and Santander say 67k borrowers took payment holidays
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of customers of Barclays and Santander have taken payment holidays, as official figures found consumers had cleared billions of pounds of debt over the last few months.

item.title: Prince William talks about homeschooling George and Charlotte
item.description: Speaking on BBC Radio 5Live's That Peter Crouch podcast, the Duke of Cambridge said 'the biggest eyeopener' for him was his shorter patience, while he's also struggled with George's maths work.

item.title: Parents want baby daughter's strawberry birthmark removed from nose because of 'Rudolph' taunts
item.description: Richard and Marie Touhladjiev, from Rhyl, north Wales, said strangers taunt little Tahlia, who is one, in the street and point at her strawberry birthmark, known as a haemangioma.

item.title: Police save girl, 3, found floating face down in swimming pool
item.description: Two officers from the Pensacola Police Department saved a girl at her grandparent's Florida home after she was found face down in their pool on June 13.

item.title: Hong Kong's hospitals could 'collapse' as city faces 'large scale' coronavirus outbreak
item.description: Carrie Lam (pictured) urged residents to follow new regulations, in force as of today, as the city grapples with a sharp rise in coronavirus cases which has seen more than 100 new daily infections.

item.title: Woman shaves hair after glue attack causes second degree burns
item.description: Marcela Tascon, 31, (pictured) was targeted on the doorstep of her home in Valencia, Spain, last week. She said an unknown man arrived holding flowers before launching his attack.

item.title: Zara Tindall and Peter Phillips 'offload' kids on Princess Anne
item.description: Zara Tindall and Peter Phillips have revealed they love to leave their kids with their mother Princess Anne in a sneak peek of a documentary airing tonight at 9pm ahead of her birthday on ITV.

item.title: Prince Joachim of Denmark will have no lasting physical injuries after suffering blood clot in brain
item.description: A spokeswoman for the Danish royal household, said in an official statement yesterday that the blood clot in Prince Joachim's brain was due to 'a sudden dissection of an artery'.

item.title: Scientist warns gloves achieve 'nothing in the way of safety'
item.description: Associate medical director of the Infection Control Program Pediatric at the University of Chicago, Allison Bartlett, said that wearing gloves can make people feel complacent.

item.title: Clay pig figurine discovered under 5,000-year-old ruins is compared to Angry Birds character
item.description: Archaeologists found the tiny sculpture while digging the remains of a small ancient community outside modern-day Guanghan in Sichuan province. They believe the artwork is 3,200 years old.

item.title: Jeremy Corbyn deletes tweet thanking Wiley for his support
item.description: Wiley - real name Richard Cowie - was permanently suspended from Twitter today after anti-Semitic comments at the weekend which are currently being probed by police.

item.title: Three killed in Reading park had single stab wounds to the neck
item.description: James Furlong (pictured), Joseph Ritchie-Bennett and David Wails had all been killed on June 20, while in a park in Reading.

item.title: Instagram is 'offering hundreds of thousands of dollars to TikTok's most popular creators'
item.description: TikTok influencers say they are being approached by Instagram with offers of hundreds of thousands of dollars to leave TikTok and go to Reels exclusively when it launches next month.

item.title: CCTV images of racist attack suspects BLURRED for 'privacy'
item.description: Derbyshire Police are hunting two males and two females after a teenager was chased by the gang in Chapel-en-le-Frith, Derbyshire, and thrown to the ground before being kicked and punched.

item.title: Plus-size woman loses five stone after ditching 4,000 calories meals and cocktails date nights
item.description: Adrienne Marsh, 24, from Hoxton, London, went from 16st 1lbs to 11st 5lbs after ditching twice weekly date nights with her boyfriend James where she would eat 4,000 calories.

item.title: Nurse of Wuhan's coronavirus hospital falls to death 'over PPE quarrel'
item.description: The unnamed cardiac nurse from Wuhan Xiehe Hospital was said to have been quarrelling with a matron over the lack of protective measures for hospital workers in the isolation wards.

item.title: UK Government signs deal with drugs giant GSK for 60 million doses of potential coronavirus vaccine
item.description: Number 10 has now signed deals for four different types of coronavirus jabs, giving the UK access to a total of 250million doses - enough to give everyone in Britain four each.

item.title: One of Britain's most-wanted murder suspects is arrested nearly four years after he fled UK
item.description: Abdulahi Shire fled the UK after Zakir Nawaz was killed in Birmingham in 2016. Police worked with Interpol to trace the Holland national and he is now in custody.

item.title: Moment furious British father confronts two teenage migrants climbing out of his ROOF BOX
item.description: The teenagers, believed to be from Eritrea and Guinea, had broken into the box and dumped most of its contents in Calais believing the BMW 4x4 was heading over the Channel.

item.title: Art from David Hockney's Paper Pools series makes a £4.8million splash
item.description: Pool on a Cloudy Day with Rain (Paper Pool 22) is one of the 29 pictures Hockney made during six weeks of experimental activity in 1978. It raised £4.8m at the Sotheby's evening sale in London.

item.title: Inmates at jail holding Ghislaine Maxwell say they had to clean floors for her
item.description: Inmates at the Brooklyn jail where Ghislaine Maxwell is being held ahead of her sex crimes trial say they were forced to clean and polish the floors three times ahead of her arrival.

item.title: Socialite stalker, 53, is on the run in Ireland as judge issues European Arrest Warrant
item.description: Ugandan-born socialite Farah Damji, once called 'London's most dangerous woman', was jailed for five years in 2016 after stalking a church warden after meeting him online.

item.title: Boris Johnson's brother Jo is locked in planning row with neighbour trying to build roof terrace
item.description: Jo Johnson, 48, claims the proposed extension and redevelopment of the derelict office in Primrose Hill, north London, will 'invade' his privacy and create an 'unacceptable degree of overlooking'.

item.title: Further 1.5 million children should be given free...
item.description: The National Food Strategy, commissioned by Government, says poorer children risk being `left behind´ and will be badly affected by Covid-19.
item.media:description: A report from the National Food Strategy has said a further 1.5m children should be brought into the free school meals programme, while poorer youngsters should also be fed during the school holidays (Chris Radburn/PA)

item.title: You'll have to BOOK an A&E appointment this winter: NHS told plans for patients to 'call first'
item.description: The plans, revealed in a board meeting for NHS England and NHS Improvement chiefs yesterday, are set to be put in place before December.

item.title: Illegal Albanian immigrants are jailed for two years over £2m cannabis farm with 3,000 plants
item.description: Albanian immigrants Emiljan Gjura, 31, and Ermir Reshiti, 35, were jailed for two years after cops raided the giant cannabis farm which was 270 yards from Southend police station in Essex.

item.title: TikTok audio illusion divides opinion as listeners hear either 'green needle' or 'brainstorm'
item.description: The sound, which first went viral in 2018 and has now resurfaced on TikTok after being shared by a user from Wales, can be heard as either the phrase 'green needle' or the word 'brainstorm'.

item.title: Vans face ban from city centres under Boris Johnson's plan to get Britain in the saddle
item.description: Compulsory 'freight consolidation schemes' will be piloted in 'one or two small historic city centres' in the UK as Boris Johnson vows to tackle Britain's obesity crisis.

item.title: World's largest nuclear fusion project in pursuit of clean power begins assembly in France
item.description: Located in Provence, the International Thermonuclear Experimental Reactor - or ITER, for short - is expected to start delivering energy in the year 2035.

item.title: Eddie Hearn's garden transformed into boxing venue as Matchroom HQ readies itself to host Fight Camp
item.description: Matchroom's headquarters in Brentwood, Essex, has been transformed into a boxing venue ahead of a series of 'Fight Camps', with Sam Eggington taking on Ted Cheeseman this Saturday night.

item.title: Woman, 37, refuses have to children to help the environment
item.description: Anna Hughes, 37, from London, who decided not to have children to help the environment said on Lorraine those who have a large family 'haven't considered' the impact on 'everyone else'.

item.title: Headteachers could be SUED for 'irrationally' forcing pupils to wear face masks
item.description: At least ten schools in England have said they will ask pupils to wear masks when they reopen, leading a law firm to warn that the policy could be challenged with a judicial review.

item.title: Prince George knows he's different from siblings because he's 'singled out' to spend time with Queen
item.description: Speaking to OK! royal expert Katie Nicholl said Prince George, seven, who is third in line to the throne, is gradually being introduced to the idea that 'he's different' from his siblings'.

item.title: Human civilization stands a 90% chance of collapse within decades, physicists claim
item.description: Within the next two to four decades Earth may no longer be able to sustain a large human population, according to a peer-reviewed paper published in Nature Scientific Reports.

item.title: UK trade deal with Japan 'could be agreed by September'
item.description: Talks with Tokyo started on June 8 and have been ongoing since then, with a 'significant breakthrough' taking place yesterday.

item.title: Almost half of employers slash hiring of graduates
item.description: Over 60 per cent of employers have also had to cancel work experience placements due to the pandemic, social mobility think tank the Sutton Trust said.

item.title: Royal London Hospital neurosurgeon, 57, amassed hoard of extreme child porn and animal abuse images
item.description: Dr Richard Van Groningen, 57, admitted five counts of possessing child abuse and bestiality images at Chelmsford Magistrates' Court yesterday and was bailed ahead of his sentence next month.

item.title: Moment angler yob hurls a beer bottle at a SEAL to stop it getting tangled in his fishing line
item.description: This is the shocking moment an angler tries to stop a seal getting caught on his fishing line by throwing a glass beer bottle at it. The incident took place at Hopes Nose in Torquay, Devon

item.title: Hilarious Instagram account dreams up nightmare fake products which thankfully do not exist
item.description: The items depicted by US-based Instagram account Worst.Buy include an imagined Xbox game featuring a recent viral picture of Mark Zuckerberg wearing sun cream while surfing.

item.title: The Apprentice's Linda Plant says healthy employees should return to office
item.description: Leeds-born CEO Linda Plant, who is known for her fearsome interviews on The Apprentice, debated the return to the office with CEO of We Love Work, Paris Petgrave on GMB this morning.

item.title: Murder suspect, 42, will appear in court charged with deaths of mother and son, four, in house fire
item.description: More than two years after the blaze in Eastbourne, East Sussex, police have charged Andrew Milne with the murders of 34-year-old Gina Ingles and four-year-old Milo Ingles-Bailey.

item.title: Germany 'will have to impose second lockdown' if it faces second wave
item.description: Jonas Schmidt-Chanasit said 'drastic measures' would be back on the table if Germany's health system is overwhelmed by virus cases - a nightmare scenario which Germany has so far avoided.

item.title: Mum-of-four Rebecca Jackson, 40, reveals how she banished her stubborn belly fat in just 16 weeks
item.description: Busy mum-of-four and clinical psychologist Rebecca Jackson, from Canberra, has shared how she banished her stubborn belly fat in just 16 weeks, and has gone from a size 16 to a slim size 6/8.

item.title: A boozy spree and bloody banknotes... CHRISTOPHER STEVENS reviews last night's TV
item.description: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: Dame Agatha Christie could scarcely have devised a more twisted coincidence. On New Year's Eve 1934, friends gathered for a card game called Murder.

item.title: UK scientists will get £4 million for Covid BAME study
item.description: New research will challenge the link between being BAME and dying from Covid. This graph shows death rates for different ethnic groups (men are in green and women in dark red).

item.title: Mother battles skin cancer that forced doctors to remove her nose but she is hoping to get married
item.description: In September 2019, Julia Davey, from Weymouth, Dorset, was diagnosed with squamous cell carcinoma, a form of skin cancer which is usually low risk, but in Julia's case was very aggressive.

item.title: Tycoon bids to build a new city for 50,000 Hong Kong residents in IRELAND
item.description: Ivan Ko has pitched his plans to Ireland officials in light of Hong Kong's controversial new security law which has left many citizens considering immigrating to the UK.

item.title: Sea otter being chased by a killer whale leaps to safety on a boat
item.description: John Dornellas, 37, who works for exploration company Coldwater Alaska, filmed the sea otter frantically swimming towards his boat as it was chased by an orca in Halibut Cove Lagoon.

item.title: Police charge 22-year-old man with manslaughter after pensioner, 72, was hit by cyclist
item.description: Peter McCombie, 72, was struck by a biker in Bow Road, Tower Hamlets, on July 3 and taken to hospital in critical condition. He died eight days later with serious head injuries.

item.title: How many royal rings can you identify?
item.description: Katherine, who runs German-based royal fan account Kats Royal Letters, shared a snap of her collection of 10 copycat rings twinkling in a jewellery box on Instagram yesterday.

item.title: Gorilla relationships are limited in large groups, study suggests
item.description: Researchers at the the University of Exeter say that when the groups get too big, some of the animals may lack the mental energy to be able to maintain multiple relationships.
item.media:description: Gorillas develop better relationships in groups of 12-20, a study suggests (Dian Fossey Gorilla Fund/PA)

item.title: Care homes suffered 'appalling' errors by ministers during coronavirus crisis, MPs warn
item.description: The social care crisis was exacerbated further by a series of 'reckless' and 'appalling' policy errors, according to a damning Commons public accounts committee report.

item.title: Woman often mistaken for a teenager shocks TikTok users by revealing she's actually 35
item.description: Sakina Jabeen, 35, from Manchester, told TikTok users she's frequently asked if she's in her early twenties - but is in fact more than a decade older and looks just as young without her make-up on.

item.title: Paralyzed dog with tetanus makes amazing recovery due to vet
item.description: Dr. Ali Thompson, 35, from Florida, adopted Bunny when she was seven months old - and had been left completely paralyzed from head to tail.

item.title: Tracey Cox reveals why sharing bedroom secrets can both help and hinder relationships
item.description: British relationship expert Tracey Cox reveals the different sex secrets that are OK to talk about with friends - and the ones you should keep private, including erection issues and penis size.

item.title: Madonna supports COVID-19 conspiracy theory video after it was removed by social media platforms
item.description: Madonna seemed to ignore the warnings of falsities in the video, and posted the video twice on social media, once after it was removed, on Tuesday.

item.title: Donald Trump questions low pandemic approval ratings saying 'nobody likes me'
item.description: President Donald Trump bemoaned his low approval ratings during Tuesday's press conference saying 'nobody likes me', blaming it on his personality.

item.title: Joe Biden's speech notes included praiseworthy comments about Kamala Harris
item.description: Joe Biden may be eyeing Sen. Kamala Harris as his pick for Vice President as he was photographed during a Tuesday event holding talking notes about the California lawmaker.

item.title: Mum shares her three-ingredient recipe for 'delicious' chocolate mousse
item.description: A mother from Sydney has shared her simple three-ingredient recipe for 'delicious' chocolate mousse, and home cooks are labelling the dessert a 'game-changer' for those looking for a sweet treat.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... working from home
item.description: 'Get back in the office, Ron - we BOTH know your holiday in Spain was cancelled'

item.title: Madeleine McCann: Investigators search German allotment
item.description: Christian Brueckner is currently in prison in Kiel for drug dealing and had launched legal proceedings to get released after serving two-thirds of his sentence. He has now dropped his bid.

item.title: Madeleine McCann witness says she saw suspect Christian Brueckner's VW camper van four years ago
item.description: A Portuguese teacher known only as Maria has claimed she saw Madeleine McCann at an Algarve supermarket four years ago. She spoke to investigative programme Sexta as 9.

item.title: Madeleine McCann: Claims she's living with German family
item.description: The Portuguese woman claims she saw a teenage girl with Madeleine's distinctive blemish in her right eye outside a supermarket in Gale near Albufeira.

item.title: Madeleine McCann suspect investigated over boy's disappearance
item.description: Jair Soares went missing when he went to buy chips at the beach near the town of Monster in the South Holland province of the country on August 4 1995.
